intro: Gouinia isabelensis, commonly known as the Isabel's gouinia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Isabel in the Solomon Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
